content:
Here is my version of the solution:
x = int(input("Print the number of elements: "))

even_list = []
odd_list = []

for i in range(x):
    t = int(input(""))
    if t % 2== 0:
        even_list.append(t)
    else:
        odd_list.append(t)

even_list.sort()
odd_list.sort()

print(" ".join(str(num) for num in even_list+odd_list))

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy and simple contribution, the statement is clear and on point. Good Job!

Any reason to present the values as loop across multiple lines instead of space separated on one line?
Newly starting reverse players might be confused by the fact that the first number is not part of the pattern (it is simply N). It would be less confusing if the values of elementList are given on one line.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a very simple question that takes some time to make a solution.
Reverse mode is interesting, but I think it's easy to tell the pattern.

Title
* Any more fitting title?

Input
* Line 1: Please change "<Integer> N" to "An integer [[N]]".

* Please change "<Integer> element_liste" to "An integer [[element_liste]]".

* Please change "N time" to "for an element in the list".

* Please change "Line 2" to "Next [[N]] lines".

Output
* Please change "Ligne" to "Line".

* Please change "<str>" to "[[N]] space-separated integers for".

* Please change "list' numbers" to "the list".

Constraints
* Please change "[N]" to "[[N]]".

* Please change "element_liste" to "[[element_liste]]".

Cases
* Suggest to add one pair of test and validator where the list contains even numbers only.

* Suggest to add one pair of test and validator where the list contains odd numbers only.

Thanks.
Not any reason other I don't know how to do it... How am I suppose to fix that ?

In your stub generator, you now have:
loop N read elementListe:int
Which can work with input like:
3
2
73
5

Instead, you can turn that stub generator line into:
loopline N element:float
Which can work with input like:
3
2 73 5

Some of the previously mentioned issues have not been fixed. Would you please follow them up?

Also, please revise the input of Validator 5 to contain even numbers only.

Thanks.

Still missing?

Input
* Please change "time" to "for an element in the list".

* Please change "Line 2" to "Next [[N]] lines".

Output
* Please change "<str>" to "[[N]] space-separated integers for".

Thank you.
